title.narrative: 5.3 ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: UNICEF EAPR has strengthened capacity to design and implement gender responsive, equity focused ADOLESCENTS programmes that deliver results for the most disadvantaged children at scale., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: COs practice programming excellence to achieve quality results for children at scale in both development and humanitarian settings

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF EAPR has strengthened capacity to design and implement gender responsive, equity focused ADOLESCENTS programmes that deliverresults for the most disadvantaged children at scale.

description.narrative: In 2021, new partnerships led to successful evidence generation, knowledge sharing, and advocacy promoting adolescents’ rights: UNICEF co-hosted four regional conferences bringing adolescents voices to the fore; completed a set of three multi-country research; and provided technical assistance on policy dialogues. Investments in advocacy conferences were significant in promoting adolescents’ voice and participation using through diverse platforms, particularly in an ongoing COVID 19 scenario where young people expressed concerns over lack of mechanisms to engage in decision-making. It enabled UNICEF to learn from young people; engage with them on programme development; and ensure that policies were responsive to their needs. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/03/2022
